results.title: A Tale of 'O' on being different
results.brief_description: Rosabeth Moss Kanter (narrator) explores the consequences of being different. It focuses on a group where there are ‘the many’, referred to as the ‘X’s‘ and ‘the few’, referred to as the ‘O’s’. What makes a person an X or an O?

results.title: A Tale for everybody
results.brief_description: An animated film about two little bugs who become so pre-occupied playing on an egg that they fail to notice when the egg cracks and a baby chick appears.

results.title: A Swiss peasant artist
results.brief_description: The original paper silhouettes of the artist Jean Jacques Hanswirth in the Chateau D’Oex Museum are photographed in stop motion so that they seem animated. Relates the story of the Swiss peasant whose craft with scissors and paper became an art.
results.description: The original paper silhouettes of the artist Jean Jacques Hanswirth in the Chateau D’Oex Museum are photographed in stop motion so that they seem animated. Relates the story of the Swiss peasant whose craft with scissors and paper became an art.

results.title: A Survey of acrylic techniques
results.brief_description: Acrylic paints and mediums are the most versatile and permanent materials available to artists today. The range of techniques is astounding. In this tape artist Russell Woody will show you the basics in creating oil-like tactile heavy painting, acrylic watercolours, marbling applications, collage and decoupage, through textile to sculpture. He will also detail all the basic rules for the use of supports, grounds and the use of the varied acrylic mediums. This tape is a practical, fast paced, easy to understand guide to all that acrylics can do.

results.title: A Story of silver
results.brief_description: Shows the place that silver has held in the past, by reference to documents and art works. Presents craftsmen of earlier times making silverware for use by churches and for the homes of great men. Demonstrates the part played by Georg Jensen, silversmithy, in the development of simpler designs more familiar today as the complex detail is omitted and the line becomes all important.

results.title: A Step from the shadows
results.creator_credit: Gary Lindberg, James Michael and Russell Manning Productions
results.brief_description: Two children hear their parents arguing. The mother, an alcoholic, will not admit that she has a problem. Eventually her husband goes to a doctor who suggests possible ways of tackling the illness. The first attempt at rehabilitation fails, but finally, after admitting that she is ill, she appears to be on the way to controlling her disease.

results.title: A Snort history
results.creator_credit: Stan Phillips and University of Denver
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film which cuts from live-action sequences to animation to depict the distortion of judgement in driving when drinking.

results.title: A Share in their tomorrow
results.brief_description: How a group of British companies are assisting, by aerial surveys, the Sudan Government to open up and develop unproductive, and previously inaccessible, terrain in the Sudan. The valuable contribution of the helicopter for surveying purposes is illustrated.

results.title: A Sense of the other (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Frank Galati, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University
results.brief_description: Shows how old English literature, such as Shakespeare, can be studied through the medium of interpretation. This is understanding the text through performing and acting out the parts, by students. Shows performances, and also discusses with students and lecturers, the value of this method of study.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dana H. Hodgdon, Frank Galati, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University

results.title: A Secret place
results.creator_credit: Kim Cardow, Susan Jones, Nicholas Oughton and College of Art
results.brief_description: Shows the outdoor play environment at the Lady Gowrie Child Centre in Brisbane where children can take advantage of conditions not always available. Tree-houses, streams, mud pools and a variety of animals combine to make this natural environment. Shows how children can interact with even the simplest part of this environment.
